lines.text: Everybody's banging everybody. It's a horny world.

[inside sanitarium]
But... I don't belong here.... I-I guess everybody says that, don't they?
What did you tell the children where I am?
They haven't asked.
What... What do you mean, "they haven't asked"?
Well, they're only... they're only little children.
I know, but... they accept things.
But... don't they miss me?

[opening title card]
This is the story of 'Albert DeSalvo', the self-confessed Boston Strangler. The characters and incidents you are about to see are based on fact.
Usually in a homicide of this kind, where nothing's stolen, it's a personal enmity, a grudge killing.
Two cases of personal enmity against two harmless old ladies in the same neighborhood in one week?
Come on, Captain, looks to me like a nut's loose.
Nuts don't ransack apartments.
So the women were strangled with a double square knot.
What are you trying to tell us, that it was a doctor or an Eagle Scout?
What about the sex? What did he actually do to them?
What's the difference?
People like to read about it.
Let them read paperbacks.
We've got a full-blown maniac on our hands.
But what can you expect from a society that itself spends 44% of its tax dollars on killing?
Excuse us, we have a date with a gunnery sergeant.
I'm sorry to disappoint you - she played the man's part, I the woman.
